classics.name: Sazerac
classics.instructions: Rinse a chilled lowball glass with absinthe. Add remaining ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into the lowball glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
classics.quote: A good choice of weaponry because it symbolizes the city of New Orleans.

classics.name: Tom Collins
classics.instructions: Add gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled (or build in a collins glass). Strain into a collins glass filled with ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a lemon wheel.

classics.name: Old Fashioned
classics.instructions: Add a sugar cube, the bitters, and a splash of water into a mixing glass (or build in a lowball glass). Muddle the sugar cube. Add ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a lowball glass with a rock of ice and garnish with an orange peel and/or cherry.
classics.quote: Call me old-fashioned, but I like my cocktails the way they were meant to be.

classics.name: Manhattan
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a cherry.

classics.name: Martinez
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with an orange twist.
classics.quote: The classic cocktail that is not a Martini nor a Manhattan.

classics.name: Martini
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with a lemon twist or olive.
classics.quote: A man must defend his home, his wife, his children, and his martini.  —Jackie Gleason

classics.name: Daiquiri
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
classics.quote: It shouldn't taste of rum, it shouldn't taste of lime and it shouldn't taste of sugar. It should just taste of daiquiri.  —Ernest Hemingway

classics.name: The Last Word
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a cherry resting at the bottom.
classics.quote: People may say what they like about the decay of Christianity; the religious system that produced green Chartreuse can never really die.  —Hector Hugh Munro (Saki)

classics.name: Sidecar
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a lemon twist.
classics.quote: Bring me a light breakfast: black coffee and a sidecar.  —Auntie Mame

classics.name: Negroni
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice (or build in a lowball glass) and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a lowball glass with a rock of ice and garnish with an orange twist.
classics.quote: A Negroni is a cocktail of true substance, one that should be respected. It's not some lightweight, fruity concoction. It's a drink for people who like their drinks to make an impression. It says, 'I'm here, I'm serious, and I don't need you to like me.'  —Anthony Bourdain

classics.name: Old Pal
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a lemon twist.
classics.quote: There is no greater remedy for the heart nor sweeter comedy for the soul than the compnay of an old pal.

classics.name: The Bee's Knees
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
classics.quote: The parties were bigger. The pace was faster. The shows were broader. The buildings were higher, the morals were looser and the liquor was cheaper.  —F. Scott Fitzgerald

classics.name: Boulevardier
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice (or build in a lowball glass) and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a lowball glass with a rock of ice and garnish with an orange twist.
classics.quote: I'll always be a boulevardier. I have an extreme reverence and romantic longing for all that is decrepit and fatalistic.  —Rufus Wainwright

classics.name: Corpse Reviver No. 2
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a lemon twist.
classics.quote: And the graves were opened: and many bodies of the saints that had slept arose, And coming out of the tombs after his resurrection, came into the holy city, and appeared to many.  —Matthew 27:52-53

classics.name: Hemingway Daiquiri
classics.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
classics.quote: 'I drink to make other people more interesting.' -Ernest Hemingway

modern.name: Vieux Carr√©
modern.instructions: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice (or build in a lowball glass) and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a lowball glass with a rock of ice. Hold an orange coin slightly above the glass with a lit match underneath the coin. Express the oils of the orange coin over the match and cocktail.
modern.quote: Laissez les bons temps rouler! (Let the good times roll!)

modern.name: Moscow Mule
modern.instructions: Add vodka and lime juice into a copper mug (or a collins glass). (Optional) drop a lime wedge or two into the bottom of the mug and muddle. Add ice and then top with ginger beer. Garnish with a lime wedge.
modern.quote: Drink like a fish, kick like mule! Uno mas!

modern.name: Margarita
modern.garnish: lime wheel; salt or sugar rim (optional)
modern.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a lime wheel. (Optional) if adding to the rim, rub a lime wedge around the rim of the glass and dip into salt or sugar.
modern.quote: If life gives you limes, make margaritas.  —Jimmy Buffett

modern.name: Vesper
modern.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with a lemon twist.
modern.quote: Three measures of Gordon's, one of vodka, half a measure of Kina Lillet. Shake it very well until it's ice-cold, then add a large thin slice of lemon peel.  —James Bond, Casino Royale

modern.name: French Connection
modern.instructions: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a lowball glass with a rock of ice.
modern.quote: I'm Irish. I can drink whatever I want.  —Popeye Doyle, The French Connection

modern.name: Espresso Martini
modern.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with three coffee beans.
modern.quote: Give me something to wake me up and f*** me up.

modern.name: Cosmopolitan
modern.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a lime twist.

modern.name: Gold Rush
modern.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a lowball glass over a rock of ice. Garnish with a lemon wheel.
modern.quote: The men who got rich in the Gold Rush were the ones who sold the picks and shovels.

modern.name: Enzoni
modern.instructions: Add five green grapes into a shaker and muddle them. Add the remaining ingredients into the shaker along with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a lowball glass with a rock of ice and garnish with three skewered green grapes.
modern.quote: The juice of the grape is the liquid quintessence of concentrated sunbeams.  —Thomas Love Peacock

modern.name: Revolver
modern.instructions: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with an orange twist.
modern.quote: No one dared to ask his business / No one dared to make a slip / The stranger there among them / Had a big iron on his hip.  —Marty Robbins, Big Iron

modern.name: Juliet & Romeo
modern.instructions: Muddle mint leaves, cucumber slices, and sea salt in a shaker. Add remaining ingredients into the shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint.
modern.quote: Romeo, Romeo, Romeo! Here's drink: I drink to thee.  —William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet

modern.name: Paper Plane
modern.instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
modern.quote: I fly like paper, get high like planes / If you catch me at the border, I got visas in my name.  —M.I.A., Paper Planes

modern.name: Outlander
modern.instructions: Add all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a lowball glass and garnish with a cherry and/or lemon twist.
modern.quote: The water was not fit to drink. To make it palatable, we had to add whiskey. By diligent effort, I learned to like it.  —Winston Churchill

modern.name: Necromancer
modern.instructions: Rinse a chilled coupe glass with gin. Add remaining ingredients into a shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into the coupe glass and garnish with a lemon twist.
modern.quote: When he had said these things, he cried with a loud voice: Lazarus, come forth.  —John 11:43
